verses.verse: And <S%G1161><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>, Thou <S%G4671><s%> art permitted <S%G2010><s%> to speak <S%G3004><s%> for <S%G5228><s%> thyself <S%G4572><s%>. Then <S%G5119><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> stretched forth <S%G1614><s%> his hand <S%G5495><s%>, and made his defence <S%G626><s%>:

I think <S%G2233><s%> myself <S%G1683><s%> happy <S%G3107><s%>, king <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%>, that I am <S%G3195><s%> to make my defense <S%G626><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> thee <S%G4675><s%> this day <S%G4594><s%> touching <S%G4012><s%> all the things <S%G3956><s%> whereof <S%G3739><s%> I am accused <S%G1458><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%>:

especially <S%G3122><s%> because thou <S%G4571><s%> art <S%G5607><s%> expert <S%G1109><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> customs <S%G5037><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> questions <S%G1352><s%> which are <S%G5607><s%> among <S%G2453><s%> the Jews <S%G1485><s%>: wherefore <S%G1189><s%> I beseech <S%G4675><s%> thee <S%G3116><s%> to hear <S%G191><s%> me patiently <S%G3450><s%>.

My <S%G3450><s%> manner of life <S%G3767><s%> then <S%G3303><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> my youth <S%G3503><s%> up <S%G3588><s%>, which was <S%G1096><s%> from <S%G575><s%> the beginning <S%G746><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> mine own <S%G3450><s%> nation <S%G1484><s%> and at <S%G1722><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%>, know <S%G2467><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%>;

having knowledge <S%G4267><s%> of me <S%G3165><s%> from the first <S%G509><s%>, if <S%G1437><s%> they be willing <S%G2309><s%> to testify <S%G3140><s%>, that <S%G3754><s%> after <S%G2596><s%> the straitest <S%G196><s%> sect <S%G139><s%> of our <S%G2251><s%> religion <S%G2356><s%> I lived <S%G2198><s%> a Pharisee <S%G5330><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> now <S%G3568><s%> I stand <S%G2476><s%> here to be judged <S%G2919><s%> for <S%G1909><s%> the hope <S%G1680><s%> of the promise <S%G1860><s%> made <S%G1096><s%> of <S%G5259><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> our fathers <S%G3962><s%>;

unto <S%G1519><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> promise our <S%G2257><s%> twelve tribes <S%G1722><s%>, earnestly <S%G1616><s%> serving <S%G3000><s%> God night <S%G3571><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> day <S%G2250><s%>, hope <S%G1679><s%> to attain <S%G2658><s%>. And concerning <S%G4012><s%> this <S%G3739><s%> hope <S%G1680><s%> I am accused <S%G1458><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%>, O <S%G67><s%> king <S%G935><s%>!
Why <S%G5101><s%> is it judged <S%G2919><s%> incredible <S%G571><s%> with <S%G3844><s%> you <S%G5213><s%>, if <S%G1487><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> doth raise <S%G1453><s%> the dead <S%G3498><s%>?

And <S%G2532><s%> punishing <S%G5097><s%> them <S%G846><s%> oftentimes <S%G4178><s%> in <S%G2596><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the synagogues <S%G4864><s%>, I strove to make <S%G315><s%> them blaspheme <S%G987><s%>; and <S%G5037><s%> being <S%G1693><s%> exceedingly <S%G4057><s%> mad <S%G1693><s%> against them <S%G846><s%>, I persecuted <S%G1377><s%> them even2193, 2532 unto <S%G1519><s%> foreign <S%G1854><s%> cities <S%G4172><s%>.

Whereupon <S%G3739><s%> as <S%G2532><s%> I journeyed <S%G4198><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Damascus <S%G1154><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> the authority <S%G1849><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> commission <S%G2011><s%> of <S%G3844><s%> the chief priests <S%G749><s%>,

And <S%G1161><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> said <S%G2036><s%>, Who <S%G5101><s%> art thou <S%G1488><s%>, Lord <S%G2962><s%>? And <S%G1161><s%> the Lord said <S%G2036><s%>, I <S%G1473><s%> am <S%G1510><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> thou <S%G4771><s%> persecutest <S%G1377><s%>.

But <S%G235><s%> arise <S%G450><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> stand <S%G2476><s%> upon <S%G1909><s%> thy <S%G4675><s%> feet <S%G4228><s%>: for <S%G1063><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> this end <S%G5124><s%> have I appeared <S%G3700><s%> unto thee <S%G4671><s%>, to appoint <S%G4400><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%> a minister <S%G5257><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> a witness <S%G3144><s%> both <S%G5037><s%> of the things wherein <S%G3739><s%> thou hast seen <S%G1492><s%> me <S%G5037><s%>, and of the things wherein <S%G3739><s%> I will appear <S%G3700><s%> unto thee <S%G4671><s%>;

delivering <S%G1807><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%> from <S%G1537><s%> the people <S%G2992><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> from the Gentiles <S%G1484><s%>, unto <S%G1519><s%> whom3739, 3568 I send <S%G649><s%> thee <S%G4571><s%>,

to open <S%G455><s%> their <S%G846><s%> eyes <S%G3788><s%>, that <S%G3588><s%> they may turn <S%G1994><s%> from <S%G575><s%> darkness <S%G4655><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> light <S%G5457><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> from the power <S%G1849><s%> of Satan <S%G4567><s%> unto <S%G1909><s%> God <S%G2316><s%>, that they <S%G846><s%> may receive <S%G2983><s%> remission <S%G859><s%> of sins <S%G266><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> an inheritance <S%G2819><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> them that <S%G3588><s%> are sanctified <S%G37><s%> by faith <S%G4102><s%> in <S%G1519><s%> me <S%G1691><s%>.
Wherefore <S%G3606><s%>, O king <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%>, I was <S%G1096><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> disobedient <S%G545><s%> unto the heavenly <S%G3770><s%> vision <S%G3701><s%>:

but <S%G235><s%> declared <S%G518><s%> both to them <S%G3588><s%> of <S%G1722><s%> Damascus <S%G1154><s%> first <S%G4412><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> at Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%>, and <S%G5037><s%> throughout <S%G1519><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the country <S%G5561><s%> of Judaea <S%G2449><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> also to the Gentiles <S%G1484><s%>, that they should repent <S%G3340><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> turn <S%G1994><s%> to <S%G1909><s%> God <S%G2316><s%>, doing <S%G4238><s%> works <S%G2041><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of repentance <S%G3341><s%>.

how that <S%G1487><s%> the Christ <S%G5547><s%> must <S%G3195><s%> suffer <S%G3805><s%>, and how that <S%G1487><s%> he first <S%G4413><s%> by the resurrection <S%G386><s%> of <S%G1537><s%> the dead <S%G3498><s%> should proclaim <S%G2605><s%> light <S%G5457><s%> both to the people <S%G2992><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> to the Gentiles <S%G1484><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> Paul saith <S%G5346><s%>, I am <S%G3105><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> mad <S%G3105><s%>, most excellent <S%G2903><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%>; but <S%G235><s%> speak forth <S%G669><s%> words <S%G4487><s%> of truth <S%G225><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> soberness <S%G4997><s%>.

King <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%>, believest thou <S%G4100><s%> the prophets <S%G4396><s%>? I know <S%G1492><s%> that <S%G3754><s%> thou believest <S%G4100><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> Paul <S%G1722><s%>, With but little <S%G3641><s%> persuasion <S%G3982><s%> thou wouldest fain make <S%G1096><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> a Christian <S%G5546><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> the king <S%G935><s%> rose up <S%G450><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> the governor <S%G2232><s%>, and <S%G5037><s%> Bernice <S%G959><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> they <S%G3588><s%> that sat <S%G4775><s%> with them <S%G846><s%>:

and <S%G2532><s%> when they had withdrawn <S%G402><s%>, they spake <S%G2980><s%> one <S%G4314><s%> to another <S%G240><s%>, saying <S%G3754><s%>, This <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G444><s%> doeth <S%G4238><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death <S%G2288><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> of bonds <S%G1199><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> unto Festus <S%G5347><s%>, This <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G444><s%> might have been <S%G1410><s%> set at liberty <S%G630><s%>, if <S%G1487><s%> he had <S%G1941><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> appealed <S%G1941><s%> unto Caesar <S%G2541><s%>.
